The nurses, doctors, front-line workers, and American people deserve leaders that rise to meet the challenges we face, not dodge responsibility. 

We owe it to them to take this virus seriously and stop the spread with a science-based approach to beat this virus. 11/11

Our singular focus should be on what we have to do here in the U.S. to suppress the virus and protect Americans. Some of my Republican colleagues seem only interested in focusing on China. This is shirking responsibility. This is failing to rise to the challenge. 10/

It simply does not have to be this way. Where is the outcry from Republicans to fix this? Why does the Republican leadership refuse to urge the Trump Administration to change course? They are putting loyalty to the President ahead of the lives of American people. 9/

Meanwhile, health care and front-line workers don‚Äôt have the equipment they need to keep them safe. Turnaround time for testing has stretched more than 10 days in many places across the country, rendering it practically useless. 8/

We need a consistent public message campaign on masks & social distancing but we have yet to see that from POTUS or GOP leadership. We've pleaded with this admin to coordinate & ramp up production of PPE & testing supplies using the DPA. 6+ months in & that still isn‚Äôt happening.

The reason we can‚Äôt reopen? Because over six months into this crisis, we still don‚Äôt have adequate PPE or testing, let alone a coherent national strategy. 

We can combat this virus, but we are actively choosing not to. That has got to change. 6/

It's infuriating to hear some Republicans continue to call for our economy and schools to reopen while states face record-high hospitalizations and deaths but have no interest in taking the necessary steps to do so safely. 5/

The American people need Republicans, especially those in Congress, to hold this President accountable and start doing what we know is necessary to address #COVID19. 
We have the ability to combat this virus, but we simply aren‚Äôt doing it. 4/

President Trump, who refuses to deliver a health & science-based message to the public, must be held accountable. Yet it seems all some Republicans want to do to solve this crisis is to only blame China instead of their own shortcomings ‚Äì that‚Äôs an abject failure of leadership. 3

China‚Äôs willful negligence and failure to be transparent aren‚Äôt responsible for the absence of national leadership in the US like Republicans would like you to believe. Trump is responsible for our woefully insufficient testing system or the lack of PPE across the country. 2/

It appears many Republicans want to distract from the US failure to address #COVID19 & they are using China to do so. We absolutely must hold China accountable for their gross negligence, but right now we can‚Äôt let anything get in the way of addressing this virus here at home. 1/
